com.canabang.genietext.core.model.server
Class EmailServer

java.lang.Object
  com.canabang.genietext.core.model.server.EmailServer

public class EmailServer
extends Object

The email server used for retrieving messages from a host, and also sending messages.

Version:
1.00 2009-05-12 Initial submission., 1.10 2009=05-31 No longer needs to know about ConnectionInfo. Now this class only holds the IMAP server and the SMTP server and nothing else. Added debug control variable.
Author:
rhaq

          Should we display debug information for server connections.

DEBUG

public static final boolean DEBUG
Should we display debug information for server connections.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

EmailServer

public EmailServer(ConnectionInfo imap,
                   ConnectionInfo smtp)
            throws MessagingException
Initiates an email server connection with the specified host information.

Parameters:
imap - The connection information needed to connect to the IMAP server.
smtp - The connection information needed to connect to the SMTP server.
Throws:
MessagingException - If there is a problem connecting to the remote service or in the event that the server could not authenticate the connection or the required folder(s) could not be opened/accessed.
Method Detail

close

public void close()
           throws MessagingException
Closes the socket connections to the mail servers and deferences them.

Throws:
MessagingException - If there are any problems closing the connection.

getImapServer

public ImapServer getImapServer()
Retrieves the IMAP server.

Returns:
The server used to receive emails.

getSmtpServer

public SmtpServer getSmtpServer()
Retrieves the SMTP server.

Returns:
The server used to send emails.
